document_data.name: Belorgan
document_data.Organization:
The family head was the Earl of [[Wyvernshores]], who owned the farmland along the southeastern coast of the [[Wyvernwater]]. The Belorgan estates were called [[Mossfarms]]. The courtesy titles of Baron of [[Lowbridge]] (a village) and Baron of [[Mossfarms]] (the Belorgan estates) were unused but held by [[Harlo]] in case he had additional children.

[[Windkeep]] and [[Fallturret]] were the names of the two castles owned by the Belorgans. The titles Baron of Windkeep and Baron of Fallturret were additional titles held in reserve by the Belorgans, after the two Belorgan castles.

Members.Living members:
* [[Harlo Belorgan]], son and heir of Lord Belorgan, currently titled Viscount of Juniril, father of Raedlar "Red" Belorgan.
* [[Alclaera Belorgan]], wife of Harlo and mother of Raedlar.
* [[Thaelmra Belorgan]], younger sister of Harlo, took Raedlar's title of Baroness of Forgemarket upon his death.
Members.Deceased: [[Raedlar Belorgan]], one of five young men who attempted to assassinate Princess Tanalasta during the Abraxus Affair in [[1369 DR]] and was killed in the attempt, rumored to have Raedlar, was titled Baron of Forgemarket (a market crossroads in the Wyvernshores countryside).
